result.name: river-tyne-to-druridge-bay-mixed-crab-and-lobster-survey-2007-08-fisheries-science-partnership
result.notes:
The fishing vessel *Wendy Patricia* was chartered between August and 
October 2007 to carry out a potting survey and an acoustic survey in the mixed 
crab and lobster fishery in an area off the northeast coast from the river 
Tyne to Druridge Bay. The main objective was to investigate the population 
structure of edible crabs in relation to the characteristics of the seabed. 
Fishing positions were spread throughout the survey area but most stations 
were in Whitley Bay and north of Newbiggin, corresponding to the pre-survey 
positions of the gear. Sidescan sonar and underwater video were used during 
the acoustic survey to map ground types in proximity to the fishing positions. 
The fishing survey took place in late August and early September and the 
acoustic survey was carried out in October.

organization.name: marine-environmental-data-information-network

organization.description: MEDIN is a partnership of UK organisations committed to improving access to marine data. Our partners are both public and private sector.

result.title: River Tyne to Druridge Bay Mixed Crab and Lobster Survey 2007/08 - Fisheries Science Partnership

resources.description: The Cefas Data Portal contains metadata records and data sets available to download and connect to in support of our commitment to open science. Data is available in the following formats: Binary download, CSV, ESRI Shapefile. The data can also be accessed via the WFS and WMS protocols.
